subject: Re: [junit] Testing philosophy question
msgSnippet: ... Yes. The real discussion is what constitutes a behavior? I m not up for it again. It s smaller than one thinks. ... Indeed. -- J. B. Rainsberger, Diaspar
messageBody:
Chappell, Simon P wrote:

> >> Ok, so what is a test? Is a test an assertEquals() method
> >call or is it
> >> a testXXX() method?
> >
> >A test is an assertion that might fail independently of other
> >assertions.
> >
> >If a group of assertions is needed to show that a behavior is correct,
> >such making sure a stack actually tracks all its elements,
> >then that is
> >one test.
>
> I like that. As many assertions as it takes to prove one behaviour.

Yes. The real discussion is "what constitutes a behavior?" I'm not up
for it again. It's smaller than one thinks.

> ><opinion>Most of the time, each assertion is a test.</opinion>
>
> Except when they're not. ;-)

Indeed.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
